metadata.query: Tell me the standard operation procedure or SOP

results.text: Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) for Goods Receiving
results.section_title: Standard Operating Procedure for Goods Receiving
results.context: Title of the SOP document for goods receiving

results.text: 3.4 Operational Standards
results.context: Standards for warehousing, transportation, and distribution

results.text: 2.0 Procedure Steps
results.context: Lists the steps involved in the goods receiving procedure

results.text: This procedure ensures that all incoming goods are handled efficiently, accurately, and safely, adhering to the Quality Policy and preventing stock reconciliation errors.
results.section_title: Standard Operating Procedure for Goods Receiving
results.context: Overview of the SOP's purpose and adherence to quality policy

results.text: 2.2 Forklift and Material Handling Equipment (MHE) Operation
results.section_title: Forklift and Material Handling Equipment (MHE) Operation
results.context: Guidelines for operating forklifts and MHE safely

results.text: This manual serves as the definitive reference for all employees regarding the standards, policies, and procedures of SAFEXPRESS LOGISTICS INC. Its purpose is to ensure a unified, safe, and efficient working environment where every team member understands their role in meeting customer expectations and achieving business objectives.
results.context: Manual as a reference for company standards and policies

results.text:
● Only certified and authorized personnel are permitted to operate forklifts and other MHE.

● Maximum speed limits within the warehouse must be strictly observed.

● Pedestrian right-of-way must be maintained; pedestrians must use designated walkways.

● Forklifts must be inspected prior to every shift (Pre-Operation Check).
results.section_title: Forklift and Material Handling Equipment (MHE) Operation
results.context: Safety rules for forklift and MHE operation

results.text: SECTION 3: GENERAL EMPLOYMENT AND OPERATIONAL POLICIES
results.context: Overview of employment and operational policies

results.text: 2.2 | Unloading Preparation | Receiving Supervisor | Clear the staging area. Ensure all required Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) is worn by the unloading team (safety vest, hard hat, steel-toed boots).
results.context: Preparation steps for unloading cargo

results.text:
Step | Action | Responsibility | Quality/Safety Check
2.1 | Vehicle/Cargo Check-in | Gate Guard / Receiving Clerk | Verify the transporter's details against the expected Delivery Order (DO) or Advanced Shipping Notice (ASN). Check the vehicle for signs of tampering or damage before docking.
results.context: Details the vehicle and cargo check-in process

results.text:
Due to the nature of logistics, strict adherence to HSE protocols is mandatory.

● Zero-Accident Policy: All personnel are required to follow safety procedures, wear appropriate Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) in designated areas (e.g., warehouses, yards), and report all hazards, near-misses, and incidents immediately.
● Compliance: All transport operations must strictly adhere to local and national traffic laws and regulations. All warehouse operations must comply with industry safety standards, particularly for Cold, Temperature-Controlled, and Ambient storage.
results.context: HSE protocols and compliance requirements

results.text: 2.7 | Put-Away & Location Assignment | Warehouse Operator | Move the verified and received stock to its assigned bin or storage area (Ambient, Cold, or Temperature-Controlled). Scan the item and the storage location to confirm placement in the WMS.
results.context: Process for putting away and assigning location to goods

results.text: 2.8 | Document Filing | Receiving Clerk | Attach the signed BOL, the System Receiving Report, and any Discrepancy Reports. File documents for record-keeping and reconciliation.
results.context: Filing process for receiving documents

results.text: To establish a uniform and controlled process for the receipt, inspection, and recording of all incoming cargo and materials, ensuring compliance with client instructions and minimizing discrepancies.
results.context: Establishes a controlled process for receiving goods

results.text:
Every employee is responsible for:

● Adhering strictly to all safety rules, procedures, and Work Instructions (WI).

● Wearing the required PPE for their assigned tasks and work areas.

● Identifying and reporting all potential hazards, near-misses, and unsafe conditions immediately to their direct supervisor or the HSE Officer.

● Participating actively in all safety training and drills.
results.context: Employee duties include following safety rules and reporting hazards

results.text: 2.3 | Unloading and Tally | Warehouse Operator | Unload cargo carefully. Perform a preliminary count (tally) against the accompanying shipper's Bill of Lading (BOL).
results.context: Describes the unloading and tallying process

results.text: 2.6 | Discrepancy Resolution | Receiving Supervisor | If there is a quantity mismatch or damage, the clerk must immediately notify the client or relevant internal department. No stock is put away until the discrepancy is acknowledged.
results.context: Steps for resolving discrepancies in received goods

results.text:
● [ ] ASN/DO verified against physical shipment.
● [ ] Total Piece Count verified (Tally vs. BOL).
● [ ] Cargo inspected for damage (Pass/Fail).
● [ ] WMS entry completed and System Receiving Report generated.
● [ ] Discrepancy logged and resolution confirmed (if applicable).
● [ ] Final put-away scan confirmed in WMS.
results.context: Checklist items for verifying receiving and dispatch processes

results.text: EMPLOYEE COMPANY MANUAL
results.context: Title of the employee company manual

results.text:
At SAFEXPRESS LOGISTICS INC., we are committed to delivering reliable, compliant logistics solutions that meet the highest standards of customer, interested parties, and stakeholder satisfaction.

● Commitment: Through operational excellence, sustainable practices, and a culture of accountability, we ensure the safe, efficient handling of diverse products in full compliance with all regulations.
● Leadership: Our management leads by example, fostering continual improvement in our Quality Management System to achieve accuracy, customer-centricity, and getting it right the first time in every step of the supply chain.
results.context: Quality commitment and leadership in logistics operations

results.text: 3.0 Control Checklists (Receiving/Dispatch Checklist)
results.context: Checklist for receiving and dispatch control

results.text:
● Warehousing: Employees involved in storage must ensure goods are handled with precision and care, maintaining the specified environmental conditions (Cold, Temp-Controlled, Dry) and optimizing inventory control and order fulfillment.
● Transportation: Vehicle operators are responsible for the safe operation and routine inspection of their assigned vehicles. They must use real-time tracking platforms to ensure visibility and timely updates for clients.
● Distribution: Personnel must optimize routes and adhere to distribution schedules to ensure swift delivery to distribution points, empowering client supply chain efficiency.
results.context: Operational standards for logistics processes

results.text: 2.5 | WMS Receiving & Validation | Receiving Clerk | Using the handheld scanner, scan the shipment reference/BOL number. Enter the verified quantity into the Warehouse Management System (WMS). The WMS generates a System Receiving Report.
results.context: Process for receiving and validating goods in WMS

results.text: Welcome to the SAFEXPRESS LOGISTICS INC. team! You are now part of a dynamic and ISO 9001:2015 QMS Certified company committed to delivering reliable, compliant logistics solutions across the Philippines. Our success is driven by our people—a skilled and experienced team dedicated to operational excellence. This manual is your guide to our company's policies, culture, standards, and expectations. We trust that you will use it as a resource to uphold the high standards of Safety, Quality, Delivery, Cost, and Morale that define the Safexpress family.
results.context: Introduction to company values and manual purpose

results.text: All employees are expected to adhere to their scheduled work hours and locations (Head Office, Warehouse, Field, etc.). Punctuality and reliable attendance are essential to maintaining the efficiency of our 24/7 logistics operations. Absences and tardiness must be reported according to department-specific procedures.
results.context: Policy on work hours and attendance reporting

results.text:
● All injuries, illnesses, accidents, property damage, and near-misses (events that could have caused harm) must be reported immediately to the supervisor and HSE Officer.

● An investigation must be conducted for every incident to determine the root cause and implement preventative measures.
results.context: Reporting requirements for accidents and near-misses

results.text: SECTION 4: EMERGENCY RESPONSE & REPORTING
results.context: Introduction to emergency response and reporting procedures

results.text: 2.4 | Initial Quality Inspection | Receiving Clerk | Mandatory Check: Inspect every pallet/carton for visible damage (crushing, wetness, torn seals). If damage is found, document it immediately on the BOL and take photo evidence.
results.context: Initial quality inspection process for received goods

results.text: SAFEXPRESS LOGISTICS INC.
results.context: Cover page of the employee company manual

results.text: SAFEXPRESS LOGISTICS INC. values continuous learning. The company provides ongoing training to maintain a skilled team and sustain the best service for our customers. Employees are expected to actively participate in all mandatory training sessions related to safety, quality, and new technology (e.g., WMS updates).
results.context: Mandatory participation in training sessions

results.text: SAFEXPRESS LOGISTICS INC. is committed to providing a safe, healthy, and environmentally responsible workplace for all employees, contractors, and visitors. Our goal is Zero Accidents and Injuries. We integrate Safety as the primary KPI in every operational decision, ensuring compliance with all Philippine laws and international standards for logistics and warehousing.
results.context: Commitment to a safe and environmentally responsible workplace

results.text:
KPI | Core Value | Definition and Expectation
Safety | Accountability | Measures the effectiveness of workplace safety protocols, aiming for zero accidents and injuries. Protect yourself, your colleagues, the cargo, and company assets.
Quality | Excellence | Assesses the quality of services by tracking defect rates, customer complaints, and adherence to quality standards. This includes ensuring 100% inventory record accuracy.
Delivery | Reliability | Evaluates the efficiency and reliability of the delivery process. Commit to timely and accurate deliveries that meet client deadlines.
Cost | Efficiency | Monitors cost efficiency in operations, focusing on reducing waste and optimizing resource usage (time, fuel, supplies, etc.).
results.section_title: Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and Core Values
results.context: Table of KPIs, core values, and expectations

results.text:
● All employees must be familiar with the Site Evacuation Plan, assembly points, and the location of fire extinguishers.

● Fire Drills must be conducted at least annually.

● In the event of a fire, the priority is to sound the alarm, evacuate, and only attempt to fight the fire if trained to do so and if the fire is small and contained.
results.context: Evacuation procedures and fire drill requirements

results.text: SECTION 2: WAREHOUSE AND MATERIALS HANDLING SAFETY
results.context: Introduction to warehouse and materials handling safety protocols

results.text: SECTION 1: HSE POLICY & COMMITMENT
results.context: Introduction to health, safety, and environmental policy commitments

results.text:
Management is responsible for:

● Providing necessary Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) and ensuring its proper use.

● Conducting regular safety audits and risk assessments across all sites (warehouses, yards, and fleet operations).

● Implementing corrective actions for all reported safety deficiencies and hazards.
results.context: Management duties include PPE provision and safety audits

results.text: Every employee’s actions must align with our five core KPIs, which serve as our essential operational values:
results.section_title: Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and Core Values
results.context: Introduction to core KPIs and operational values

results.text: 1.2 Purpose of the Manual
results.context: Purpose and scope of the employee manual

results.text:
As an ISO 9001:2015 QMS Certified company, quality is non-negotiable.

● Documentation and Accuracy: Utilize the Warehouse Management Systems (WMS) correctly to ensure real-time inventory tracking and accurate reporting. Errors in documentation directly impact our Quality KPI.
● Continuous Improvement: Employees are encouraged to suggest improvements to processes that enhance efficiency, safety, and compliance.
results.context: Quality management practices and continuous improvement

results.text: SECTION 3: TRANSPORTATION & FLEET SAFETY
results.context: Introduction to transportation and fleet safety requirements

results.text: 1.1 HSE Mission Statement
results.context: Statement of commitment to safety and environmental responsibility

results.text: SECTION 1: INTRODUCTION AND WELCOME
results.context: Introduction to the company and welcome message

results.text: 4.3 First Aid
results.context: Guidelines for first aid provisions and responsibilities

results.text:
All employees are expected to conduct themselves with the highest degree of professionalism, integrity, and respect.

● Client-Centricity: We put our clients at the core of our day-to-day lives. All interactions with clients and partners must be professional, cooperative, and focused on solving their needs.
● Confidentiality: All company information, client data, inventory details, pricing structures, and operational strategies are strictly confidential and must not be disclosed to unauthorized parties.
results.context: Professionalism and confidentiality expectations for employees

results.text: 3.1 Code of Conduct and Professionalism
results.context: Expectations for employee conduct and professionalism

results.text: 3.2 Health, Safety, and Environment (HSE)
results.context: Mandatory adherence to HSE protocols

results.text: 2.3 Quality Policy (QMS)
results.context: Commitment to quality and compliance in logistics

results.text:
● First aid kits are maintained in designated, easily accessible areas (e.g., Office, Dispatch Center, Warehouse Office).

● A list of certified First Aiders for each shift must be posted publicly.
results.context: Locations of first aid kits and certified aiders

results.text: 4.3 Training and Development
results.context: Commitment to employee training and development

results.text: 3.3 Quality Management and Compliance
results.context: Quality management and compliance expectations
